hero.Heading: Produce a global Tech leader beyond borders.
hero.Paragraph: Becoming Global Tech Leaders Together. We empower people with advanced tech skills, crossing borders to create future tech innovators. Join us on this journey to become a global tech leader.

about.Heading: VISION
about.Paragraph: Designing Futures through Belief and IT
about.Paragraph2: To achieve the goal to be an experienced professional and gain the soft skills to work as one global team.
about.reason: Welcome to IMANI HACKING BOOTCAMP, where we transform knowledge into formidable skills. We're a dedicated tech training center committed to helping you reach your IT potential. With expert-designed bootcamp programs for beginners and professionals, we offer flexibility through online learning. Join us on the journey to IT excellence and innovation.

content.Title: Contents
content.Heading: Video Session
content.Paragraph: Students will have a course that given from the lectures, in order to have a great knowledge of the technology that student want to be in the future
content.Paragraph2: Students meet their mentors in order to have a disscuss about the projects, soft skills and hard skills, also asking about the future plan of the Students.
content.Paragraph3: In weekly, Student will have a zoom live lecture about the development skills including, self development, soft skills, hard skills, in order to be ready working as engineer in the future after participating in our porgramming bootcamp.
content.Lecture Session: In weekly, Student will have a zoom live lecture about the development skills including, self development, soft skills, hard skills, in order to be ready working as engineer in the future after participating in our porgramming bootcamp.
content.Subparagraph1: Basics of front end development -HTML / Javascript / Phyton
content.Subparagraph2: Basics of Design concepts and skills including: Usability, Accessibility, User Interface
content.Subparagraph3: A structure for the code, including Bulma CSS Framework etc
content.Subparagraph4: Recognize and prevent common security exploits such as SQL-Injection / XSS etc
content.Subparagraph5: Problem-solving / Decision-making / Critical Thinking / Global mind-set / Communication as Team
content.Subparagraph6: How to Effectively communicate Tech info to non-tech audience

instructor1.name: Dr Kelechukwu N. Onwukamike
instructor1.desc: Developing sustainable cellulose-based materials, mentoring students, and holding dual PhDs in Organic and Polymer Chemistry from KIT Germany and University of Bordeaux France, I'm a Research Scientist at Procter &amp Gamble Germany, emphasizing human capacity development.

instructor2.name: Daniel Joseph Makyao
instructor2.desc: Daniels is experienced software developer skilled in Python, Django, PostgreSQL, and MERN stack. Committed to continuous learning and staying current with the latest tech trends, emphasizing precision in all project aspects, from improving features to developing new products. Skills: Python, Java, Java Script, React.

instructor3.name: Emmanuel Tarimo
instructor3.desc: As a data scientist and data analyst, I excel in collecting, cleaning, and analyzing complex data, crafting predictive models, and delivering actionable insights. Also a web developer, building dynamic and secure websites using Python frameworks.

instructor4.name: Nuha Nuru Ayubi
instructor4.desc: Nuha Nuru is an experienced professional in Python, Pandas, C, and Robotic Process Automation (RPA) using the UiPath platform. He is a dedicated individual with a daily commitment to exploring and discovering new technologies.

instructor5.name: Gerry Sabar
instructor5.desc: 8+ years of hands-on experience in software development and testing, spanning analysis, data modeling, design, project delivery, and collaboration across all organizational levels.

mentor1.name: Saki Yanagihara
mentor1.desc: International education enthusiast with a multicultural background, pursuing a Master's in Education in Japan. A new business builder, adaptable in various roles for social development projects, passionate about fostering understanding and academic growth, with a broad professional network.

mentor2.name: Naho Chujo
mentor2.desc: Former international NPO social worker in Kenya, now the Director of Greendy Association, with expertise in community management, research, problem-solving, and mentoring. GCI data science summer school 2020 alumnus, currently in a data science startup role.

mentor3.name: Douglas Fortunatus
mentor3.desc: Guiding engineers in executing diverse development projects, including E-commerce sites and APIs, and collaborating on Node-API development. Proficient in React, HTML, CSS, PHP, Laravel, Vue.js, Python, and JavaScript. As a work officer, she shares project management expertise. Skills: PHP, Java, JavaScript, Swift, Node.js, React.js, Laravel.

country1.name: Tanzania
country1.desc: In Tanzania, there is an intensified effort to train the workforce in the field of IT, but there is a shortage of job opportunities. Industrial diversification is a key challenge, while the rapidly growing IT and software industry is considered one of the vital primary sectors.

country2.name: Indonesia
country2.desc: In Indonesia, efforts to boost teacher skills mainly center on computer literacy rather than addressing IT education issues. Nationwide expansion plans are in early pilot stages without a clear strategy. Indonesia is also seen as a promising opportunity for IT engineers to work in Japan remotely or in-office.

country3.name: Philippines
country3.desc: In the Philippines, educators' skills are improving, with a focus on computer literacy rather than IT education. Nationwide expansion is in early pilot stages with no clear strategy. The Philippines is seen as a chance for global collaboration and relationship-building.

news1.desc: We Start Bootcamp Program for the 1st student from Tanzania.

news3.desc: We start IT bootcamp for 2sd student from Tanzania.

news4.desc: We start IT bootcamp for 1st student from Indonesia.
